channel.title: The Clifford Corner => The Cliffords Little Space on the Web
channel.description: An archive of my mindless ramblings...

item.title: 2012 Year in Review
item.description:
Holy smokes, what a year! Two new additions to the Clifford Clan! Ms. Emily Winter became Mrs. Emily Clifford, and little Ross Clifford was born. The California Clifford's bought a house and moved from the big city to the burbs. Where should I begin!

Let's start with the Big Wedding! Colin and Emily decided to tie the note in beautiful Dahab, Egypt - a small backpacker/resort town known for outstanding scuba diving.

The entire party met up at the Dahab Paradise resort, where we all would be staying and where the ceremony would be happening.

This wedding was an event none of us shall soon forget. Complete with camel rides, dancing with Bedouin, scuba diving, and a fantastic ceremony and meal. Thank you Colin and Emily for letting us all be part of this fantastic experience!

The other big was the birth of a second child. A little boy named Ross John Clifford. He was born in late November, weighing in at about 6 1/2 pounds. A little smaller than Tom, but he makes up for it in appetite. Poor Debbie is constantly feeding the little guy.

To keep things even more interesting, we sunk our life savings into a house in the burbs, moving just south of San Francisco to a town called Burlingame. We love the extra space, the lively little town, our enormous (to us) back yard, and the slower pace of things. We really miss our friends in San Francisco, the fantastic restaurants, and the fact it is so easy to get around there (we find ourselves driving more than we ever did). Please, if anyone feels the need to eat some good food, drink some good wine, and hang out in the burbs, look us up, we'd love to have you.

Now, with Christmas and New Years approaching, family is descending on us. And we are so incredibly grateful for it. We are honestly looking forward to handing off the kids and catching some naps, and maybe dinner out or something. We really could use it.

To all the rest out there that we haven't talked to in a while - please forgive us. We promise to get better once we find our grove with two kids. It's been a little chaotic this year
item.author: noreply@blogger.com (MichiganCliffy)

item.title: Photo of Colin, Emily, and Ruthie
item.author: noreply@blogger.com (MichiganCliffy)

item.title: The Burbs
item.description:
Yes, it's true, we have officially moved to the burbs. While we are very, very sad to be leaving Noe Valley and San Francisco, we are ecstatic at the house we managed to find and the town we moved to. If we haven't sent you all an email with our new address, let us know, and please excuse our baby addled brains. It's been an extremely hectic couple of months.

Burlingame (our new home) is about 20 or so minutes south of San Francisco, and about 5 minutes from the SFO airport. We don't know a whole lot about the town other than the schools are good. We are looking forward to exploring more once we've gotten all settled.

Debbie and I got extremely lucky in buying this house, we managed to get it before the housing market exploded - we don't think we would be able to buy this house with the current prices.

Anyway, we're looking forward to hosting you all as soon as we've managed to unbox everything.
item.author: noreply@blogger.com (MichiganCliffy)

item.title: Big News!
item.description:
Finally getting around to updating CliffordCorner, but it's been quite an exciting year so far.

On to the news! It looks like another member of the Clifford Clan found somebody to sucker into marrying them. Colin is getting hitched! Colin, in a way only Colin could, proposed to Emily and she actually said "yes!" For friends of Colin out there, I strongly recommend getting ahold of him (yeah, I know, impossible) and asking him about how he actually proposed. Priceless Colin.

Emily, we are all ecstatic to have you in our wacky family. I thought it was incredibly brave of you to come out to San Francisco when Tommy was born - talk about a challenge - and now you are going to meet up with our parents in Rome! Miss, you are a strong woman!

Colin, we can't wait for the big event! Just remember, you only purpose right now is to help keep Emily sane during the planning process. In my limited experience, massages help, as do wine and chocolates.
item.author: noreply@blogger.com (MichiganCliffy)

item.title: 2011 - The Fastest Year Of Our Lives
item.description:
Where has the year gone?!?!?! Both Debbie and I feel like this past year just flew by, is it really 2012?!?! Has Tommy really just turned One?!?!?! As you can probably tell by the posts on this site, this year has been all about Tom - we really haven't done much else.

We both feel so lucky to have little Tom Tom in our lives. He is such a happy little guy to have around, and he brightens our days with his smiles and laughter.

It has been amazing to watch him grow from tiny infant, to walking toddler, we can't wait to see what happens in the next year.

Our Tommy Timeline

A sampling of photos starting from Tommy's birth through till Christmas. I am amazed at how he has changed in such a short time.
item.author: noreply@blogger.com (MichiganCliffy)

item.title: Halloween Cuteness
item.description: Little man looked insanely cute in his little dragon outfit. He stayed patient with his dad as we walked all over Noe Valley checking out the trick or treaters...
item.author: noreply@blogger.com (MichiganCliffy)

item.title: Blue Angels and the Pumpkin Patch
item.description:
We dared take Tom Tom to Nicks place to watch the Blue Angels buzz San Francisco. We got him some headgear to muffle the sounds of the jets, and he appeared to enjoy himself - his parents certainly did.


We also took him down to Half Moon Bay to pick out a pumpkin. He's a little young to really take in the chaos, but again, it was a lot of fun for his parents. Well, it was fun until he decided to get sick in the back of the car.
item.author: noreply@blogger.com (MichiganCliffy)

item.title: Hardly Strictly Bluegrass
item.description: We dared to take Tommy to a free festival in the park. We both took a Friday afternoon off so we, hopefully, could avoid the crowds. Tommy was his usual curious self, and kept trying to meet new people and flirt with all of the women around us.
item.author: noreply@blogger.com (MichiganCliffy)

item.title: Evening Exercises
item.description: As you can tell, Debbie and I have been busy trying to keep up with little Tom Tom. He's climbing over things, crawling all around the house, and generally exploring as much as he can.
item.author: noreply@blogger.com (MichiganCliffy)

item.title: Oh Yeah, He's Mobile
item.author: noreply@blogger.com (MichiganCliffy)

item.title: Bouncing Around in a Bounce-A-Roo
item.description: He loves bouncing around in his bouncy chair, and it makes us happy just watching him
item.author: noreply@blogger.com (MichiganCliffy)

item.title: Tommy's Eight Month
item.description: Can you believe it! Over seven months have passed since little Tom Tom was born. He's growing so fast, we can barely keep up. He's on the verge of crawling - right now he drags himself around the play mat. As you can see, he's starting to eat solid foods, and especially loves fruits - I think he's inherited his parents sweet tooth.
item.author: noreply@blogger.com (MichiganCliffy)

item.title: Tommy Laughing
item.description: I just can't help but giggle every time I see this. Tommy's got such a fun laugh and it' so contagious.
item.author: noreply@blogger.com (MichiganCliffy)

item.title: Memorial Day Getaway to the Anderson Valley
item.description:
Feeling the need to escape the confines of San Francisco, Debbie, Tommy and I headed up to Anderson Valley - up in Mendocino County.

Not a lot of sunshine, but plenty of wine and beautiful scenery.
item.author: noreply@blogger.com (MichiganCliffy)

item.title: A Little Rice Cereal
item.description:
He's not a fan . Back to breast milk and formula, for a little while longer.

He's growing so fast, we're having to retire clothes at an ever increasing speed. And as you can tell by this video, he has a very expressive face. He's so much fun to be around, and he is a very good natured little boy, even when his folks try and force nasty food down his mouth.
item.author: noreply@blogger.com (MichiganCliffy)

item.title: Playing with Mr Squeak
item.description:
Mr Squeak a video by MichiganCliffy on Flickr.

I love this little video clip of Tommy playing on his little floor gym.
item.author: noreply@blogger.com (MichiganCliffy)

item.title: Tommy's Fourth Month Continued.
item.description: Too cute not to share
item.author: noreply@blogger.com (MichiganCliffy)

item.title: Tommy's Fourth Month
item.description:
Some fun photos from the past couple of weeks.

Tommy is growing fast and learning new things every day! He is so much fun to be around.
item.author: noreply@blogger.com (MichiganCliffy)

item.title: Tommy Laughing
item.description: Our little man has a wonderful sense of humor. He loves funny faces and sounds, and his goofy daddy loves to make funny faces and sounds. It is absolutely amazing to watch him develop.
item.author: noreply@blogger.com (MichiganCliffy)

item.title: Tommy's Third Month
item.description:
He's growing so fast! He is a very happy baby, with lots of smiling and laughing. He's started to make those cute baby sounds, and he's discovered his hands - at least as something to suck on.

His sleeping habits are not too bad. He crashes out at about 8 PM every night, and then wakes up at around 2 or 3. One feeding and then he's out again until maybe 5 or 6. Very manageable, although I'd give my right arm to be able to sleep in once in a while.

Debbie and I feel very lucky, he is a fantastic little guy. We're enjoying every moment.
item.author: noreply@blogger.com (MichiganCliffy)

item.title: Morning Playtime
item.description: Turn up the volume and listen to Tommy gurgle and squeak.
item.author: noreply@blogger.com (MichiganCliffy)

item.title: Story Time!
item.description:
I love this shot of Debbie reading to Tommy. He looks so attentive and engrossed in the story, but I think it's mostly gas.

Every morning, Debbie picks out a couple of books and reads to Tommy. I'd like to do the same in the evening, but he's way to fussy for a story.

He's getting bigger, almost 10 lbs (that's a guess right now), and his smiles just melt your heart.
item.author: noreply@blogger.com (MichiganCliffy)

item.title: Tommy's Second Month
item.description: Some photos and videos from Tommy's first month. It's amazing how quickly time goes by, and how quickly he is growing.
item.author: noreply@blogger.com (MichiganCliffy)

item.title: Happy Holidays From All Of Us
item.description: The Clifford Clan wish you and yours a Happy Holidays and a very Merry New Year!
item.author: noreply@blogger.com (MichiganCliffy)

item.title: Some More Photos and Videos
item.description: For your viewing pleasure, some more videos and photos from Tommy's first week.
